entries.title: Books, books, books
entries.description: I wanted to soak up all the knowledge I'd been accumulating by diving into Twitter and other social networks. I also started digging into several technical books like "The Programmer's Brain," "The Pragmatic Programmer," and "The Clean Coder." I figured it was time to broaden my horizons and reinforce those good practices 💪.

entries.title: Developed some cool projects
entries.description: I started developing personal projects to learn various technologies. My focus shifted towards creating bots for Telegram using JavaScript and TypeScript. Additionally, I began exploring the use of 3D on the web through libraries like ThreeJS or React Three Fiber 🧊.

entries.title: My first talk!
entries.description: I decided to share the knowledge I had learned using these 3D libraries by giving a talk to other developers. It was an experience I loved and hope to repeat.

entries.title: Courses, courses, courses
entries.description: I started devouring courses (and actually finishing them!). The one I enjoyed the most was a Vue 3 course taught by Maximilian Schwarzmüller.

entries.title: Portfolio remake!
entries.description: After getting a solid grip on Vue 3, and since I was eager to dive into Nuxt 3, I figured it was time to give my portfolio another makeover to put what I've learned into practice.

entries.title: Joined Zapp Studio as a Frontend Developer
entries.description: Career level up (again!) 🏠🚀

entries.title: Started to remake my portfolio
entries.description: My portfolio was overdue for an update, so I decided to rebuild it from the ground up, incorporating new technologies I've learned recently (11ty, Jekyll, etc.).

entries.title: Graduated in Higher Technician in Web Applications Development
entries.description: Ending with an overall grade of 9.31/10 and receiving several honorable mentions. Pretty good ✨.

entries.title: Joined Capgemini as a Web Developer
entries.description: Career level up 🏠🚀

entries.title: Discovered the path of good programming practices
entries.description: I start getting interested in topics like SOLID principles, Test-Driven Development (TDD), or Hexagonal Architecture. I consume a lot of content on these topics (like CodelyTv), and I begin using Twitter to stay updated on current trends. Thanks to that, I also start reading technical books 🌌

entries.title: Absorbing knowledge
entries.description: I decide to enroll in a 6-month training program in my city where they teach HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, SQL, and Symfony. I juggle this with courses on Udemy 🔥

entries.title: That damn virus 🦠
entries.description: Unemployed and unable to leave my house, I start creating small projects and uploading them to GitHub. Calculators, simple portfolios. I learn how to deploy on Netlify and GitHub Pages.

entries.title: Started a Higher Technician in Web Applications Development: DAW
entries.description: I had no intention of returning to university. I was seeking a program that offered a shorter duration but would still adequately prepare me, both theoretically and practically. Thus, I decided on the Higher Technician in Web Applications Development, which is the highest educational level in Spain before pursuing a university degree.

entries.title: Decided to go back to study 📚
entries.description: After several years of job hopping and realizing that architecture wasn't my true passion, I decide to enroll in a Higher Technician program in Web Applications Development. Unfortunately, the course doesn't start until next year.

entries.title: My (not so) first line of code 🏃
entries.description: Although I had dabbled with Java, HTML, and CSS in previous years, it wasn't until this moment that I began programming seriously. With still a year left before the course began, I made it my goal to learn as much as I could by then.

entries.title: Graduated at UCAM as a Building Engineer 🎓
entries.description: After five years of hard work, I finally graduated from university. Those were years I cherish dearly, especially for the friendships and experiences I had. Now, my professional journey begins! 🚀

entries.title: Got my first job
entries.description: Thanks to an internship program at my university, I secure a job at a Real Estate company conveniently close to my home. In this job, I learn how to navigate a professional environment and manage to get promoted several times. I become responsible for specific areas of work, assisting in the training of new employees.

entries.title: Started an university degree in Building Architecture
entries.description: Not sure what to study, I decided to follow what I loved most at the time: drawing. In my surroundings, there wasn't much enthusiasm for technology, and even less belief in software development as a feasible way to earn a living.

entries.title: Got my first Pokémon game
entries.description: Even though I had already dabbled in video games, my PC couldn't handle much, so my parents decided to get me a red Game Boy Pocket along with Pokémon Red.

entries.title: Video Games, here I come! 💻
entries.description: I started to get interested in video games by reading specialized magazines. This led me to delve deeper into the world of computing.
